elements.title: Contingent Liabilities and Recent Accounting Pronouncements

data.value: Amounts are accrued for the resolution of claims that have either been asserted or are deemed probable of assertion, with no contingent liabilities recorded as of December 31, 2022 and 2021.
The FASB issued ASU 2016-13 for recognition of credit losses, effective 2023. The Company evaluated it as having an insignificant impact.
The Company concluded that certain investments' values were misstated for 2021, resulting in various overstated and understated amounts which were corrected in the 2022 financial statements.
Evaluated significance of events occurring after December 31, 2022, as of April 4, 2023.
The Company accounts for a significant portion of its financial instruments at fair value as required by GAAP.
The assets and liabilities recorded at fair value in the consolidated balance sheets are measured and classified in a three-level hierarchy for disclosure purposes.
Financial assets and liabilities for which the values are based on unadjusted quoted prices for identical assets or liabilities in an active market.
Financial assets and liabilities for which the values are based on quoted prices in markets that are not active.
Financial assets and liabilities for which the values are based on prices or valuation techniques that require inputs that are both unobservable and significant.
During the years ended December 31, 2022 and 2021, the Company purchased $262.8m and $142.7m, respectively, of investments that are classified as Level 3.
As of December 31, 2022 and 2021, the Company held $586.6m and $571.9m, respectively, of investments that are classified as Level 3.

data.value: Eurobank Ergasias, Fairfax India Holdings, Recipe Unlimited Corporation

This table presents Atlas Corporation's investment portfolio, showing carrying values, included values, and market values for 2021 and 2022, along with economic ownership percentages. The total portfolio carrying value increased from $1,585.0M in 2021 to $2,076.3M in 2022, while market value grew from $1,348.2M to $1,505.4M. Major holdings include Eurobank Ergasias (11.3% ownership), Fairfax India Holdings, and Recipe Unlimited Corporation (21.3% ownership). The portfolio shows overall growth in both carrying and market values between 2021 and 2022.

data.value: The accompanying consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (GAAP). The consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the Company and its subsidiaries, with intercompany transactions eliminated.

The Company considers certain accounting policies that are most dependent on the application of estimates and assumptions as critical accounting estimates, including the valuation of reserves for unpaid losses, analysis of recoverability of deferred income tax assets, and valuation of the investment portfolio.

Majority of the Company's investments are categorized as held for trading and recorded at their estimated fair value based on quoted market prices. Cash equivalents include certificates of deposits totaling $46.2m and $22.4m as of December 31, 2022 and 2021, respectively.
Investment income is recorded as earned net of applicable investment expenses, with realized gains or losses determined based on average cost.

elements.title: Audit Procedures and Financial Statement Assessment

data.value: In performing an audit in accordance with US GAAS.
Exercise professional judgment and maintain professional skepticism.
Identify and assess the risks of material misstatement.
Obtain an understanding of internal control relevant to the audit.
Evaluate the appropriateness of accounting policies used.
Conclude on the Company's ability to continue as a going concern.
Communicate with those charged with governance regarding significant audit findings.
Required supplementary information about incurred and paid claims development.
Applied certain limited procedures to the required supplementary information.
The methods utilized for estimating ultimate losses include ratio of losses from previous periods, loss ratio methods, BF methods, and incurred loss development methodology.

(i) Historical loss emergence trends are indicative of future loss development trends; (ii) Internally developed pricing trends are a reasonable basis for determining loss ratio expectations; (iii) No provision for extraordinary future emergence of new classes/types of loss.
The Company completes comprehensive loss reserve reviews on an annual basis.
Adjustments to premium estimates generate appropriate adjustments to ultimate loss estimates in the quarter they occur.

data.value: The Company participates in Lloyd’s through its 100% ownership of the capital provider for Newline Syndicate (1218), providing 100% of the capacity.
The fair value of pledged securities and cash in support of Newline Syndicate (1218) is $378.1m as of December 31, 2022.
The Company's contingent liability to the Society and Council of Lloyd’s is limited to the aggregate amount of the pledged assets.
The Company expects to continue to actively operate Newline Syndicate (1218) and does not anticipate that the pledged assets will be utilized.
ORC agreed to guarantee the performance of all the insurance and reinsurance contract obligations of Compagnie Transcontinentale de Réassurance (CTR) due to its insolvency.
ORC guarantees payment of all insurance contract obligations of Falcon Insurance Company.
$174.0 million based on Falcon’s loss reserves.
ORC is paid a fee of 0.25% of all gross premiums earned.
The Company and its subsidiaries are involved in ordinary litigation, arbitration, and regulatory assessments, but outcomes are not likely to be material.
